content.description: Ascend the obvious right facing dihedral up to a 2 bolt anchor.  This is a great starter trad climb as it eats up pro.
content.location: This is the rightmost climb on Tinka.  You can approach from either side of the dome pretty easily following ledge systems.  Alternatively, rappel directly to the belay station from rap rings, 25m.

content.description:
Start offwidth crack, up and to the right.  Step up off the ledge onto a great section of moderate slab.  Continue to the anchors.

Cozy belay ledge with anchor.
content.protection: Medium cams for lower section, 5 bolts.  Bolted anchors at both bottom and top.
content.location: Start at bolted lower anchor.  Be careful rapping into this station, as it is 31m (60m rope, on an extended anchor, with stretch...)

content.description: Fantastic mantle start (protected by bolt).  Step right to great left leaning lieback.  Follow crack: either continue up, or step right for more challenging slab (10a variation) and several bolts.
content.location: Tinka center.  It's nice to belay from the shady tree.  Either rap down or walk around (skier's) right side of the dome.

content.description: Start by following a balancy thin left leaning crack to a set of knobs.  From knobs go straight up to a ledge.  On ledge, move hard right to a large feature and head straight up the bolt line.  Easy.
content.protection: 7 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.  Rap rings.
content.location: Belay from the shade of the tree, you'll be there a while.

content.description: Balancy start, 2 bolts to enter a nice hand crack.  Exit crack right when you encounter bolts and proceed up slab.
content.protection: 2 bolts, some medium cams, then 4 more bolts.  Same anchor as Scooby Snacks & Trad Dad.

content.location: Obvious right leaning, horizontal off width that starts to the right off Polish Princess.
